Sentencas: The initial stages of the interaction between the Fe-Cr alloy metallic interconnect and Sr-doped LaMnO3 (LSM) electrode of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) were investigated under cathodic polarization at the temperature range of 700-900 degrees C. Cr deposits on the Y2O3-ZrO2 (YSZ) electrolyte surface increased with the polarization time.
Titulo: Early interaction between Fe-Cr alloy metallic interconnect and Sr-doped LaMnO3 cathodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, it was observed that at the early stages of the reaction, there is no preferential Cr deposition at the three-phase boundary areas at the LSM electrode/YSZ electrolyte interface re-ion.
Titulo: Early interaction between Fe-Cr alloy metallic interconnect and Sr-doped LaMnO3 cathodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: With the decrease of the temperature the Cr deposition reduced significantly, probably due to the significant reduction in the partial pressure of the gaseous Cr species and the cationic diffusivities in the LSM electrode.
Titulo: Early interaction between Fe-Cr alloy metallic interconnect and Sr-doped LaMnO3 cathodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The results clearly demonstrated that the deposition of Cr species at the LSM electrode/YSZ electrolyte is basically a chemical reaction and kinetically controlled by the nucleation reaction between the gaseous Cr species and the Mn2+ species generated under cathodic polarization.
Titulo: Early interaction between Fe-Cr alloy metallic interconnect and Sr-doped LaMnO3 cathodes of solid oxide fuel cells
